content.description: This is a unique line that happens to be a bit shorter than most of the stuff up here. On the far left side of the wall there are a couple of seams. Start down and on the right one with a good right hand side pull pinch. A very nice side pull crimp for the left allows you to reach left to an awesome 1 1/2 finger pocket side pull. Fall into a clever crimp on the shield, and hit the "spear tip" undercling out left (this spear tip shaped hold is a very good way of identifying the line). With the spear tip and the crimp slap up right and left and then sail through some shapely jugs at the top.
content.location: Far left side of the wall.

content.description: Sweet & Low traverses left on a very awesome set of holds low on the wall. You could make the traverse as hard/easy as you want. At the good side pull jug pocket, move straight up to the slopey knob pinch above you. Then fire up to a perfect jug, and more good jugs to finish it off.

A good moderate dyno problem, though you can surely find a way around that if you want to. Just left of Half-life, start at huge deep pockets and launch upwards for a distant vertical pinch, that, of course, is slopey at the bottom, and pretty darn good the higher you get it. This problem does have a sort of tricky top out. The large, pointed block on top left is solid.
content.location: far right side of the wall, left of Half-life.

content.description: On the far right side of the wall locate a beautiful, overhanging arete. Optional starts, but with the left hand on the good deep saucer pocket, and the right hand pinching, move up and left to a distant side pull finger bucket. Slap for the all too perfect jug on the arete, and then think your way through the top out. Pretty good for what it is.

From the  start of Too old to die young crank up to the obvious dish, with some body tension fire up to the obvious gaston with yer left, reset and fire to the bomber pocket high and left... Now keep it together over the top!  Sent by Lee on one his first days out as a new father! Big congrats on the beautiful Delaney and the FA!
content.protection: Pad or two, really nice landing though...
content.location: Half Life Wall, same start as TOTDY.

content.description: On the middle/right side of the wall is a steep, featured seam, with a large hand pod at the start. Good finger bucket up and left.

pathTokens: Land of High Bouldering AKA The Ridge

content.description: The Half-life wall is a quaint, shorter wall that hosts a variety of moderate problems on bulgey terrain.  After a bit of cleaning, this wall turned out to be a perfect warm up wall nestled in between the Long Ryders Wall and the Booze Pig Wall. A very good place to start the day!!
